description: Unique text identifier for the assembly (Primary key)
Strain name from which the assembly was derived (foreign key to Strain.name).
Number of contigs in the assembly
Reference to the actual assembly data
Unique identifier for each ASV/OTU (Primary key)
Unique name assigned to the ASV/OTU, usually md5sum
Unique identifier for the bin (Primary key)
Human-readable, unique name for the bin
Identifier of the metagenomic assembly that the bin belongs to (foreign key to Assembly.name)
Array of contig identifiers included in the bin
Unique internal identifier for the community (Primary key)
Type of community, e.g., isolate or enrichment
Type of community, e.g., isolate or enrichment
Reference to the Sample from which the community was obtained.
Reference to the name of a parent community, establishing hierarchical relationships
Reference to the experimental or environmental condition associated with the community
List of strains that comprise the community, if the community is defined
Free-text field providing additional details or notes about the community
Unique identifier for the condition (Primary key)
Unique text name describing the condition
Unique, human-readable name of the DubSeq library
Foreign key to the associated genome (Genome.name) from which the library was derived
Number of unique DNA fragments in the library
Unique internal identifier for the gene (Primary key)
Unique external identifier for the gene
Name of the genome to which the gene belongs (foreign key)
List of alternative names or identifiers for the gene
Contigs are indexed starting at 1, as in KBase
DNA strand of the gene (+ for forward, - for reverse)
Genomic start coordinate on the contig, indexed starting at 1 as in KBase
Genomic stop coordinate in base pairs
Annotated biological function of the gene
Unique identifier for the genome (Primary key)
Name of the microbial strain associated with the genome (foreign key)
Number of contigs in the genome assembly
Number of annotated features (e.g., genes) in the genome
Link to where the genome itself is actually stored
Unique identifier for each image (Primary key)
Unique name (e.g., filename) for the image.
MIME type specifying the image file format (e.g., image/jpeg)
File size of the image measured in bytes
Image dimensions (e.g., width × height) expressed in pixels
URL or file path linking to the stored image
Unique identifier for the location (Primary key)
Latitude of the location in decimal degrees
Longitude of the location in decimal degrees
Continent where the location is situated
Continent where the location is situated
Environmental or geographic feature at the location
Environmental or geographic feature at the location
Unique identifier for the protocol (Primary key)
Unique, human-readable name of the protocol
URL linking to additional documentation of the protocol, such as protocols.io
Unique identifier for each reads dataset (Primary key)
Link to the reads file (e.g., fastq)
Unique identifier for the sample (Primary key)
Location where the sample was collected (Foreign key)
For below-ground samples, the average distance below ground level in meters where the sample was taken
For above-ground samples, the average distance above ground level in meters where the sample was taken
MIxS environmental package classification of the sample
MIxS environmental package classification of the sample
Free-form description or notes about the sample
Unique identifier for each strain (Primary key)
Genome object for sequenced, wild type strains
Name of the parent strain from which this strain was derived, if created by genetic modification or similar process
List of gene identifiers that have been altered in this strain, if created by genetic modification, if known
Unique identifier for a taxon record (Primary key)
Unique taxon name, typically the scientific name
NCBI taxonomy identifier for the taxon, if available
Unique, human-readable name of the TnSeq library
Foreign key to the associated genome (Genome.name) from which the library was derived
Type of primers used to generate the library
Number of reads that mapped to the reference genome
Total number of distinct barcode sequences detected in the library
Number of barcodes deemed usable after quality filtering
Number of distinct transposon insertion sites identified in the library
Proportion of essential genes with at least one transposon insertion
Proportion of non-essential (other) genes with at least one transposon insertion
Key for dynamic data type (N-dimensional array)
CDM column data type, variable or dimension_variable
Dimension number, starting at 1, for dimension variables
Dimension data type, ontology term CURIE
Variable number within a dimension, numbered starting at 1
Dimension variable data type, ontology term CURIE
Original representation of this variable in the CORAL data dump CSV
Ontology that each term is from
List of synonyms for a term
Indicates that values are links to other tables (Ref) or ontological terms (ORef)

Semicolon‑separated map of properties to values for terms that are CORAL microtypes, including scalar data_type, is_valid_data_variable, is_valid_dimension, is_valid_data_variable, is_valid_dimension_variable, is_valid_property, valid_units, and valid_units_parent
Unique identifier for each process record (Primary key)
Reference to the specific process type used to generate the outputs
Reference to the specific process type used to generate the outputs
Reference to the person or lab that performed the process
Reference to the person or lab that performed the process
Reference to the ENIGMA campaign under which the data were generated
Reference to the ENIGMA campaign under which the data were generated
Protocol used in this process (foreign key to Protocol.name)
List of references to data that were input to this process
List of references to data that were produced by this process
Molecule from list, ontology term CURIE
Molecule from list, ontology term CURIE
Molecule from list, ontology term CURIE
Molecule from list, ontology term CURIE
ENIGMA Labs and Personnel, Comment=Contact Person or Lab, ontology term CURIE
ENIGMA Labs and Personnel, Comment=Contact Person or Lab
Read Coverage, Statistic=Average, Comment=cov80 average coverage after trimming highest and lowest 10 percent
Sequence Identity, Statistic=Average, Comment=average percent identity of aligned reads
Read Coverage, Comment=percent of 1kb chunks of genome covered by at least one read
Primary key for dynamic data type (N-dimensional array)
Name of the data brick (N-dimensional array)
Description of the data brick (N-dimensional array)
Metadata for the data brick (N-dimensional array)
Data type for this data brick, ontology term CURIE
Data type for this data brick
Shape of the N-dimensional array, array with one integer per dimension
Array of dimension data types, ontology term CURIEs
Array of dimension variable types, ontology term CURIEs
Array of variable types, ontology term CURIEs
Date when this dataset was withdrawn, or null if the dataset is currently valid
Dataset that supercedes this one, if the dataset was withdrawn and replaced, or null if the dataset is currently valid
